questions.question: I am _______ tired to continue working.
She _______ her keys in the car yesterday.
The meeting was _______ until next week.
He _______ his promise to help me.
questions.explanation: break a promise yaygın bir söz öbeğidir

questions.question: The company _______ off 50 employees last month.
Please _______ me a favor and close the window.
questions.explanation: do someone a favor deyimsel bir ifadedir

questions.question: The new policy has _______ a lot of controversy.
She _______ down the job offer because of the low salary.
The project _______ through due to lack of funding.
The government is trying to _______ inflation under control.
The scandal _______ to light after an investigation.
questions.explanation: come to light = ortaya çıkmak, öğrenilmek

questions.question: We need to _______ up with new ideas for the campaign.
The evidence _______ to his involvement in the crime.
The new regulations will _______ into effect next month.
The CEO _______ down last year after 20 years of service.
The lawyer _______ loopholes in the contract.
The committee _______ a blind eye to the violations.
questions.explanation: turn a blind eye = görmezden gelmek

questions.question: The proposal _______ well with the shareholders.
The company _______ the market with cheap products.
questions.explanation: flood the market deyimsel bir ifadedir

questions.question: She _______ her authority to intimidate employees.
She _______ to the gym every morning.
They _______ in Paris for five years.
questions.explanation: For + zaman dilimi ile present perfect kullanılır

questions.question: I _______ my homework right now.
questions.explanation: Şu anda olan eylemler için present continuous kullanılır

questions.question: If I _______ you, I would accept the offer.
questions.explanation: İkinci koşul cümlelerinde tüm şahıslar için were kullanılır

questions.question: The book _______ by millions of people.
She _______ English since she was a child.
By the time you arrive, I _______ the report.
questions.explanation: Gelecekte bir zamandan önce tamamlanacak eylem için future perfect

questions.question: The meeting _______ when I got there.
questions.explanation: Geçmişte daha önce olan eylem için past perfect

questions.question: I wish I _______ more time to study.
questions.explanation: Şimdiki zamanla ilgili hayaller için wish + geçmiş zaman

questions.question: The house _______ for three months before it sold.
The results _______ by the committee next week.
Not only _______ late, but he also forgot the documents.
_______ circumstances would I reveal that information.
questions.explanation: Under no circumstances ile devrik yapı

questions.question: Rarely _______ such dedication in young employees.
The data _______ analyzed before conclusions can be drawn.
Little _______ that the decision would change everything.
Fill in the blanks: Learning a new language (1)___ time and practice. You need to (2)___ regularly.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: The weather (1)___ nice yesterday, so we (2)___ to the park.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Technology (1)___ rapidly, and we must (2)___ to these changes.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: The company (1)___ its employees excellent benefits, which (2)___ job satisfaction.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Despite (1)___ warnings, many people (2)___ to take precautions.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: The research (1)___ that students who study regularly (2)___ better results.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: The phenomenon (1)___ extensively, yet scientists (2)___ to find a definitive answer.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Economic policies (1)___ carefully to avoid (2)___ unintended consequences.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: The implications (1)___ far-reaching and (2)___ careful consideration.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Researchers (1)___ this issue for decades, yet consensus (2)___ elusive.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: The paradigm shift (1)___ profound changes in how we (2)___ reality.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Contemporary discourse (1)___ increasingly polarized, making constructive dialogue (2)___.
questions.explanation: Her iki boşluğu da doğru doldurun

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Scientists (1)___ climate change for decades. They (2)___ that immediate action is needed.
Fill in the blanks: The committee (1)___ the proposal carefully before (2)___ a decision.
Fill in the blanks: Education (1)___ opportunities for people (2)___ improve their lives.
Fill in the blanks: The company (1)___ innovative products, which (2)___ customer satisfaction.
Fill in the blanks: Modern medicine (1)___ significantly, (2)___ countless lives worldwide.
Fill in the blanks: Researchers (1)___ solutions to problems that (2)___ global challenges.
Fill in the blanks: International cooperation (1)___ essential for (2)___ environmental issues.
Fill in the blanks: The government (1)___ policies that (2)___ economic growth and stability.
The project will succeed provided that _______.
Not only did she complete the task, _______.
The company thrived _______ the economic downturn.
Had I known about the meeting, _______.
The innovation was revolutionary, _______ it transformed the industry.
Scarcely had the CEO announced the decision _______.
The findings were significant _______ they challenged existing theories.
The research was groundbreaking _______.
options: in that it challenged existing theories

questions.question: The economy recovered quickly, _______ experts had predicted.
The team will achieve success _______ they work together effectively.
The innovation was revolutionary _______ it transformed the entire industry.
The regulations must be followed, _______ severe penalties will apply.
The findings were significant _______ they contradicted previous assumptions.
The proposal gained support _______ initial skepticism.
The system operates efficiently, _______ reducing operational costs.

A: Would you like some coffee? B: _______.
A: Could you help me with this? B: _______.
A: What do you do? B: _______.
A: I failed the exam. B: _______.
options: I am sorry to hear that

questions.question: A: Would you mind closing the window? B: _______.
A: I was wondering if you could review my proposal. B: _______.
A: The meeting has been postponed. B: _______.
A: The findings contradict previous research. B: _______.
options: We need to verify the methodology

questions.question: A: I appreciate your input on this matter. B: _______.
A: The implications are far-reaching. B: _______.
options: Indeed, we must consider all ramifications

questions.question: A: This warrants further investigation. B: _______.
A: Shall we meet at 3 pm? B: _______.
A: The report is due tomorrow. B: _______.
options: I will have it ready on time

questions.question: A: What did you think of the presentation? B: _______.
options: It was quite informative and well-structured

questions.question: A: We need to address this issue urgently. B: _______.
options: I agree, let us prioritize it immediately

questions.question: A: The data suggests a different conclusion. B: _______.
options: We should reconsider our initial hypothesis

questions.question: A: This approach seems counterproductive. B: _______.
options: Perhaps we should explore alternative strategies

questions.question: A: Have you reviewed the contract? B: _______.
options: Yes, I found a few clauses that need clarification

questions.question: A: The deadline has been extended. B: _______.
options: That gives us more time to refine our work

questions.question: Which sentence is closest in meaning? "She is a teacher."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The book is on the table."
options: The table has the book on it

questions.question: Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The weather was bad yesterday."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "He finished his work early."
options: His work was completed ahead of schedule

questions.question: Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The project was successful."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "They postponed the meeting."
options: The meeting was rescheduled for later

questions.question: Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The results exceeded expectations."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The policy proved controversial."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The findings corroborate the hypothesis."
options: The evidence supports the proposed theory

questions.question: Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The legislation addresses critical issues."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The paradigm shift was inevitable."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The discourse remains polarized."
options: The discussion continues to be divided

questions.question: Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The implementation was flawed."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The outcome surpassed expectations."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The theory lacks empirical support."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The methodology proved robust."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The consensus emerged gradually."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The framework requires refinement."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The analysis yielded insights."
Which sentence is closest in meaning? "The intervention proved effective."
Complete the paragraph: Water is vital. (1)___ It helps our body function. (2)___ We should drink enough daily.
options: We need it to survive / Without it, we get sick
It is blue / It is wet
Water is cold / Water is hot
We swim in it / We drink coffee
It rains sometimes / Snow is water

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Exercise is important. (1)___ It makes us stronger. (2)___ Regular activity improves health.
options: Our body needs movement / Physical fitness matters
We sit all day / We are lazy
Exercise is hard / We do not like it
Gyms are expensive / We have no time
Sports are fun / Games are good

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Technology changes fast. (1)___ New innovations appear constantly. (2)___ We must adapt continuously.
options: Progress drives development / Adaptation is essential
Technology is bad / We hate change
Old is better / New is worse
We use phones / We have computers

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Education opens doors. (1)___ Knowledge creates opportunities. (2)___ Learning should never stop.
options: Skills lead to success / Growth requires education
School is boring / Teachers are strict
Books are heavy / Study is hard
We do not learn / Education fails
Grades are important / Tests are difficult

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Environmental protection requires action. (1)___ Individual choices matter significantly. (2)___ Collective efforts produce results.
options: We must change our habits / Together we can make a difference
Environment is fine / No action needed
Nothing we do matters / We cannot change anything
Someone else will fix it / Not our problem
Nature handles itself / Earth is strong

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Cultural diversity enriches society. (1)___ Different perspectives foster innovation. (2)___ Understanding promotes harmony.
options: Variety strengthens communities / Respect creates peace
One culture is enough / Diversity confuses
Differences cause problems / Unity requires sameness
We should separate / Mixing is bad
Culture does not matter / Traditions are old

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Economic inequality poses challenges. (1)___ Disparities affect social stability. (2)___ Solutions require comprehensive approaches.
options: Imbalance threatens cohesion / Multifaceted strategies are necessary
Inequality is natural / Nothing can change it
Rich deserve more / Poor deserve less
Economics is complicated / We cannot understand
Money solves everything / Wealth is all

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Scientific research advances knowledge. (1)___ Discovery drives progress. (2)___ Investment yields benefits.
options: Innovation requires investigation / Funding produces returns
Science is boring / Research wastes money
We know enough / No more discovery needed
Old knowledge suffices / New ideas confuse
Science is hard / We should stop

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Globalization transforms economies. (1)___ Interconnectedness increases rapidly. (2)___ Adaptation becomes imperative.
options: Integration accelerates constantly / Change demands flexibility
Economics stays local / No global impact
Transformation is bad / Old ways better

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Ethical considerations guide progress. (1)___ Moral frameworks shape decisions. (2)___ Integrity remains paramount.
options: Values inform choices / Principles must prevail
Ethics are flexible / Morals change freely
Right and wrong are unclear / No absolute truth
Success matters most / Ethics are secondary
Rules are arbitrary / Values are subjective

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Paradigmatic shifts redefine understanding. (1)___ Conventional wisdom faces challenges. (2)___ Reassessment becomes necessary.
options: Fundamental assumptions require examination / Critical analysis proves essential
Old thinking is fine / No change needed
Wisdom never changes / Understanding is static
Paradigms are fixed / Shifts are impossible
Conventional is safe / New is dangerous

questions.question: Complete the paragraph: Epistemological questions persist. (1)___ Knowledge acquisition proves complex. (2)___ Certainty remains elusive.
options: Understanding develops gradually / Absolute truth proves unattainable
Knowledge is simple / We know everything
Questions have answers / Certainty is easy
Nothing is complex / All is clear
We understand fully / No mystery remains
